today_in_history_posts.title: [BIP proposal] Private Payments
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Clark and Alfred debated using bech32 for compact QR codes, reaching agreement.
- They considered a third-party service for OP_RETURN payloads, offering privacy but less censorship resistance.
- Solutions like publishing Merkle Trees and multiple service subscriptions were proposed to ensure notification delivery.

today_in_history_posts.title: Achieving Zero Downtime Splicing in Practice via Chain Signals
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Laolu Osuntokun suggested adding a signal for splicing detection in the Lightning Network.
- Lisa Neigut questioned the proposal, fearing it contradicts the aim for indistinct onchain footprints.
- They discussed minimizing communication failures and contemplated the minisketch project for future improvements.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies are divided into passive and active categories.
- Passive investments may lead to societal issues like asset underutilization.
- The article explores using deflationary currencies to stabilize economies.
